Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello-

My name is Grace Thomas and I am a newly minted Data Specialist wit=
h the Library of Congress Web Archiving team - you may start to see my name=
 on this listserv more often as I learn the intricacies of crawling the int=
ernet!

Currently, I am working on a fairly small crawl of Wikipedia pages.=
 Just two hops out, but Heritrix is struggling to harvest the content. Many=
 of the links are redirects, then it hangs on a -404 at robots.txt, without=
 checking the remainder of the seeds.

Are there particular measures anyone=
 takes with crawling Wikipedia? Has anyone also run into this issue crawlin=
g Wikipedia specifically? I've done quite a few test crawls with varying be=
an combinations, all with the same result, but perhaps I am overlooking  so=
mething. Any advice is much appreciated!

Thank you,
Grace

--_000_5FD5EC14815FF441B9F66D9533CDAA700185C1667B3ALCXCLMB02LC_
